intro: Aeschynomene baumii var. baumii, commonly known as the smallleaf aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves with a lanceolate shape. Its flowers are clustered in loose inflorescences and are usually pale green to yellowish in color. It is often found in disturbed soils and is used in some traditional practices.
